title: Manchu people
summary: The Manchu[note 2] (Manchu: ᠮᠠᠨᠵᡠ; Möllendorff: manju; Abkai: manju; simplified Chinese: 满洲族; traditional Chinese: 滿洲族; pinyin: Mǎnzhōuzú; Wade–Giles: Man3-chou1-tsu2) are an officially recognized ethnic minority in China and the people from whom Manchuria derives its name.[14][15] They are sometimes called "red-tasseled Manchus", a reference to the ornamentation on traditional Manchu hats.[16][17] The Later Jin (1616–1636) and Qing dynasty (1636–1912) were established and ruled by Manchus, who are descended from the Jurchen people who earlier established the Jin dynasty (1115–1234) in China.
